titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Willard S. Richardson papers FA1391

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-03-13 17:07:20 -0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection consists primarily of personal letters from John D. Rockefeller Jr. and John D. Rockefeller Sr. to Willard Richardson.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Richardson's granddaughter donated the collection to the RAC in 2017.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Rockefeller Archive Center has title, copyright, and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them, and has authority to grant permission to cite and publish archival material from the collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Willard S. Richardson (1866-1952) was a college friend and later advisor to John D. Rockefeller Jr. Born in Painesville, Ohio, Richardson was an alumni of the International YMCA Training School (later, Springfield College). He attended Denison University for two years, and received his B.D. from Union Theological Seminary in 1897. Richardson served as executive of the Laura Spelman Rockefeller Memorial from 1918 to 1922.
